researchPrograms.title: Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowship (SURF)
researchPrograms.description: An 11-week summer program where undergraduates conduct research with Purdue faculty and graduate mentors, culminating in a symposium. SURF fellows receive a $6,000 stipend and optional on-campus housing.
researchPrograms.eligibility: Open to undergraduates from Purdue and other institutions; first-time participants prioritized.

researchPrograms.title: Discovery Undergraduate Interdisciplinary Research Internship (DUIRI)
researchPrograms.description: Offers Purdue undergraduates interdisciplinary research experiences in the Discovery Park District. Students work on cutting-edge projects across disciplines, receiving mentorship and a summer fellowship for their research.
researchPrograms.eligibility: Purdue undergraduates (all majors) with interest in interdisciplinary research

researchPrograms.title: Summer Research Opportunities Program (SROP)
researchPrograms.description: An eight-week summer research experience aimed at preparing students (especially from underrepresented groups) for graduate school. SROP participants engage in intensive research and professional development to gain a competitive edge for graduate education.
researchPrograms.eligibility: Rising juniors and seniors; open to students from any institution and discipline (with focus on underrepresented groups)
researchPrograms.funding: Stipend ($4,500) plus housing and travel support

researchPrograms.title: Louis Stokes Alliance for Minority Participation (LSAMP) Research Program
researchPrograms.description: Provides underrepresented minority undergraduates with research experiences and mentorship during the academic year and summer. The program supports students in STEM fields through hands-on research, professional development, and funding to prepare for graduate school.
researchPrograms.eligibility: Underrepresented students in STEM majors at Purdue (all levels)

researchPrograms.title: Summer College of Agriculture Research Fellowship (SCARF)
researchPrograms.description: A summer research fellowship for Purdue Agriculture undergraduates to explore plant science and other STEM fields. SCARF fellows conduct full-time research, attend science communication workshops and seminars, and gain exposure to industry through tours.
researchPrograms.eligibility: Purdue undergraduates in College of Agriculture (all departments)
researchPrograms.funding: Paid research fellowship (support for research and travel)

researchPrograms.title: Veterinary Scholars Summer Research Program
researchPrograms.description: A summer research program introducing veterinary and pre-veterinary students to biomedical and clinical research. Participants undertake mentored research projects and engage in professional development, with an opportunity to present at a national veterinary research symposium.
researchPrograms.eligibility: Veterinary students and undergraduates interested in veterinary or biomedical research

researchPrograms.title: Undergraduate Research Fellowship (Honors College)
researchPrograms.description: A credit-bearing research experience for Honors College students to complete their scholarly project requirement. Participants are matched with faculty and grad student mentors to learn research methodologies and professional development skills, with an opportunity for a travel grant upon completion.
researchPrograms.eligibility: Honors College undergraduates (primarily in STEM majors)
researchPrograms.funding: Course credit (1-3 credits) and $500 travel award for project completion

researchPrograms.title: College of Education Undergraduate Research Training Program
researchPrograms.description: Year-long program where selected education undergraduates work as research trainees with faculty. Students assist in all phases of educational research (design, data collection, analysis, reporting) and attend a weekly research methods seminar, providing a strong foundation for graduate study.
researchPrograms.eligibility: Education majors (juniors/seniors recommended) with strong academic records and interest in research
researchPrograms.funding: Stipend ($1,500 total) and 6 research course credits

researchPrograms.title: Vertically Integrated Projects (VIP) Program
researchPrograms.description: The VIP program engages undergraduate students in multi-year, multidisciplinary team research projects for academic credit. Students from first-year through senior work with faculty on ongoing research and design teams, gaining hands-on experience and mentorship over multiple semesters.
researchPrograms.eligibility: Open to undergraduates from all majors; first-year students can join and continue through senior year

researchPrograms.title: First-Time Researcher Fellowship (FTR)
researchPrograms.description: A spring-semester fellowship that enables Purdue undergraduates with no prior research experience to engage in research part-time. Participants spend ~10 hours/week in a research lab under faculty mentorship and receive a $1,000 stipend to jump-start their research careers.
researchPrograms.eligibility: Purdue undergraduates (primarily Engineering-affiliated) with <1 semester of prior research experience

individualResearchProjects.title: IDEAS Lab – Robotics and AI Research
individualResearchProjects.description: The IDEAS Lab is seeking undergraduate researchers to work on projects in robotics and computer vision. Students will help develop AI models for human-centered robotics and AR/VR, requiring experience with computer vision frameworks and machine learning. Strong programming skills (Python/C++/MATLAB) and knowledge of algorithms and linear algebra are needed.

individualResearchProjects.title: 3D Environment Rendering Automation
individualResearchProjects.description: This project involves creating a pipeline to render 3D environments (trees and forests) using Blender. The undergraduate researcher will write Python scripts to automate object rendering and work with PhD students on cutting-edge computer graphics visualization techniques.

individualResearchProjects.title: Motion Blur Prevention in Displays
individualResearchProjects.description: Research project to develop a web-friendly demonstration of a method that reduces motion blur on standard LCD/OLED displays. An initial prototype exists; the student will help implement the technique for fast-moving imagery in a browser. Beneficial skills include web development, strong programming ability, and knowledge of image or signal processing.

individualResearchProjects.title: Visual Computing Trends Analysis
individualResearchProjects.description: This summer project aims to survey recent developments at the intersection of computer graphics, computer vision, and deep learning. The student will help review and summarize recent research (with potential help from Large Language Models) and assist in developing educational material on state-of-the-art visual computing techniques.

individualResearchProjects.title: Safe Reinforcement Learning for Robotics
individualResearchProjects.description: Project #1 in the CoRAL Lab: investigate methods to ensure persistent safety during reinforcement learning in robotic applications. The goal is to guarantee that robots operate safely even while the AI model is training. The project can lead to publishable results in top AI conferences.

individualResearchProjects.title: Visual Generalization in Imitation Learning
individualResearchProjects.description: Project #2 in the CoRAL Lab: develop techniques for better visual generalization in imitation learning and reinforcement learning from raw pixel data. The research will explore how AI agents can learn from visual inputs and generalize to new scenarios in a simulated environment.

individualResearchProjects.title: Spectral Representation for Imitation from Video
individualResearchProjects.description: Project #3 in the CoRAL Lab: explore using Markov Decision Process (MDP) spectral decomposition to learn representations for adversarial imitation learning from video data. The student will investigate low-rank representations that can improve learning from visual demonstrations.

individualResearchProjects.title: Invasive Crayfish Education Study
individualResearchProjects.description: The Coastal & Great Lakes Social Science Lab seeks a research assistant to help study how teachers use live crayfish in classrooms and the risks of invasive species. The student will transcribe and analyze interview data on teacher practices and motivations, contributing to research on preventing the spread of invasive crayfish.

individualResearchProjects.title: 3D Artist/Unity Developer for AR/VR
individualResearchProjects.description: Purdue's Envision Center is hiring students to create 3D art assets and develop Unity simulations for virtual and augmented reality projects. Roles include building 3D models, textures, and interactive Unity scenes for research and learning environments.

individualResearchProjects.title: CFD Simulation of Wind Loading on Structures
individualResearchProjects.description: A past research opening where an undergraduate assisted with computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations of structures under wind load. The student used CFD software to model wind effects on structural designs and helped interpret the simulation results.
